title.native: 劇場版 ハイスクール・フリート

description: The students of four marine high schools, including Yokosuka Girls, participate in an operation to prevent pirates manning a heavily-armed seafort from making its way to Japan. During this time, Mashiro struggles with an important decision: to become the captain of a ship or stay with the Harekaze and her friends.

tags.name: Ships
tags.description: Prominently features the use of sea-based transportation vessels.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Pirates
tags.description: Prominently features sea-faring adventurers branded as criminals by the law.

tags.name: Educational
tags.description: Primary aim is to educate the audience.

tags.name: Coastal
tags.description: Story prominently takes place near the beach or around a coastal area/town. Setting is near the ocean.

title.native: ハイスクール・フリート OVA

name.native: ヴィルヘルミーナ・ブラウンシュヴァイク・インゲノール・フリーデブルク

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yamibun)

A freelance writer who specialises in military and historical research. He graduated from Hokkaido University's Department of Literature and Philosophy.

His most important work was the multimedia project Strike Witches, for which he provided military and world research aide as well as penned scripts for the anime series and wrote lyrics for several related songs. His other works include short novel stories for various magazines, like MC Axis, two currently serialised manga series with Tsuki no Umi no Rua (Young King Ours) and Sailor Fuku to Juusensha (Champion Red Ichigo) and several doujin works. He did also write scripts and was SF aide for the Gonzo anime series Last Exile, Witchblade, GunXSword and Solty Rei.

He is member of the doujin circle Firstspear.

(Source: Anidb)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yamibun)

A freelance writer who specialises in military and historical research. He graduated from Hokkaido University's Department of Literature and Philosophy.

His most important work was the multimedia project Strike Witches, for which he provided military and world research aide as well as penned scripts for the anime series and wrote lyrics for several related songs. His other works include short novel stories for various magazines, like MC Axis, two currently serialised manga series with Tsuki no Umi no Rua (Young King Ours) and Sailor Fuku to Juusensha (Champion Red Ichigo) and several doujin works. He did also write scripts and was SF aide for the Gonzo anime series Last Exile, Witchblade, GunXSword and Solty Rei.

He is member of the doujin circle Firstspear.

(Source: Anidb)

__[Profile (F.M.F Corporation)](http://www.fmf-music.com/creators2.html#id69)__ | __[Blog (JP)](http://sk55.seesaa.net/)__

__Birthplace:__ Takayama City, Gifu Prefecture, Japan
__Favorite Artists:__ Brian Eno, Coldcut, Miles Davis

__Shigeo Komori__ is a Japanese keyboardist, music producer, composer and arranger.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/151679259) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=1304769)

A freelance designer. He hasn't been active as an animator in over a decade.

[Website](https://trysail.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/trysail_staff) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCuI2in6tTAjsaqzdeOeWZkQ) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/trysail_official_goods/) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/3YmAt9U9INQwxAwfgMVfKD)

A seiyuu girl group belonging to Music Ray'n agency under Sony Music Japan. They also host A&G+ Radio "TriAngle Harmony" together.

__Members:__
• [Momo Asakura](https://anilist.co/staff/118479/Momo-Asakura)
• [Sora Amamiya](https://anilist.co/staff/116517/Sora-Amamiya)
• [Shiina Natsukawa](https://anilist.co/staff/118818/Shiina-Natsukawa)

Currently seated at Studio Z.

Applied to Studio No. 1 as a 15-year-old in the hopes of getting to work with [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/), but there were no seats available. She then instead joined [Osamu Kamijou](https://anilist.co/staff/155388/)'s studio.

_Note: Not to be confused with the [younger animator](https://anilist.co/staff/274813/)._
